SENT.plain: We report the case of a fatal myofascial necrosis caused by an imipenem-resistant Aeromonas hydrophila in a patient with a history of aplastic anemia
He presented with fever and left thigh tenderness
The CT scan was consistent with cellulitis and, after cultures were obtained, empirical treatment with imipenem and amikacin was started
Two days later, necrotic bullae appeared on his thigh, and cultures showed Aeromonas hydrophila which was imipenem-resistant
Although surgical debridement was performed and ciprofloxacin was initiated, the patient died
